entry.attrib: Geography Lesson
School children get a geography lesson.

In the morning a rooster is crowing. John awakens. The sun is shining already. He rubs the sleep out of his eyes. John goes to the bathroom. He turns on the tap on and washes himself. John is fresh again,
He goes downstairs for breakfast. His mother says: "Good morning!"
John replies: "Good morning!" Then he butters a sandwich. He lays two pieces of cheese on it. The sandwiches tastes very good.
John has to take his bag. Now he can go to school along with Maria. They both attend the same school.
"Hello. How are you?" asks Maria.
"Very good!" says John with a smile. "And how are you doing?" asks John.
"Reasonable. I'm very tired." says Maria. Together they walk into the classroom.
The teacher hangs a world map on the wall. "Which countries do you know already?" asks the teacher.
Maria points her finger into the air. "That boot. That's Italy! My grandmother lives there." says Maria.
The teacher turns her head and asks: "Does someone else know another country?"
"That big island. That's Australia" calls Willem.
"In that country live a lot of kangaroos." says the teacher. The teacher asks then: "In which country is that big wall situated?"
All the children shout loudly throughout the class: "China!"
"Indeed. It's the 'Great Wall of China' and it's very old!" The teacher looks at her class and asks: "In which country are the pyramids situated?"
"They're situated in Mexico!" says John.
The whole class is laughing; "No. They're situated in Egypt." says Maria.

"In both countries are pyramids situated, though I meant those from Egypt." The teacher walks through the class. She looks to see if all the pupils are writing this information in their notebooks. "Just one other question; In which country do people eat lots of baguettes and drink a lot of wine?"
"In France!" calls Jacques.
The teacher is satisfied. She sends the pupils outside. They have a break.
